heroIntro: Imagine waking up to Mediterranean sunshine year-round, stepping into your own private Spanish retreat where holiday memories are made every single day. areaSection: Gran Alacant is a rapidly emerging coastal gem on Costa Blanca's southern stretches, characterized by its modern urban planning and excellent infrastructure. Located in the municipality of Santa Pola, this purpose-built development sits perfectly positioned between the historic charm of Alicante and the natural beauty of the southern coast. The area enjoys over 300 days of annual sunshine with average temperatures reaching 18°C in winter and 28°C in summer, creating an ideal Mediterranean climate year-round. Gran Alacant's recent development has resulted in contemporary architecture, wide tree-lined avenues, and thoughtfully designed residential communities. The area is witnessing steady appreciation with property values increasing 8% year-on-year, reflecting growing investor confidence and rising demand from international buyers seeking authentic Mediterranean living without the overcrowding of older Costa Blanca resorts.
lifestyleSection: Living in Gran Alacant means embracing a relaxed Mediterranean rhythm where beach days blend seamlessly with modern convenience. The established international community here speaks English widely, creating a welcoming environment for holiday home owners and expats. Your daily life revolves around proximity to pristine Blue Flag beaches accessible within 20 minutes, morning coffee at local cafés overlooking the Mediterranean, and evening paseos through charming neighborhoods. The area boasts excellent supermarket chains including Mercadona and Lidl alongside authentic local markets where Spanish produce vendors sell to both locals and international residents. World-class golf courses dot the surrounding region, perfect for leisurely rounds between beach sessions. Dining experiences range from casual beachfront chiringuitos serving paella and fresh seafood to refined restaurants catering to cosmopolitan tastes. The established expat infrastructure means you'll find English-speaking professionals for everything from healthcare to legal services, removing barriers to comfortable seasonal living.

faqs.question: Is Costa Blanca a good place to buy property?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Costa Blanca ranks among Europe's most stable property markets with consistent appreciation (8% annually in Gran Alacant), established infrastructure, excellent healthcare and international education, and a thriving expat community. The region attracts serious investors alongside lifestyle buyers seeking Mediterranean living.

faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, non-EU citizens can freely purchase property in Spain without restrictions. UK buyers benefit from existing EU-era agreements facilitating straightforward transactions. A Spanish fiscal identification number (NIE) is required for all foreign property buyers, easily obtained through our legal partners.

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Beyond the €410,000 purchase price, expect additional costs: notary fees (0.5-1%), property registration (0.5-1%), legal fees (1-2%), and property transfer tax (6-10% depending on region). Total acquisition costs typically total 8-12% above purchase price. Ongoing costs include annual property tax (0.4-1.1% of cadastral value) and community fees if applicable.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa to buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: No visa is required solely for property purchase. However, extended residence requires visas depending on nationality – UK citizens typically apply for temporary residence permits (requiring €27,000+ annual income proof or property ownership). Consult Spanish immigration authorities regarding your specific circumstances.

faqs.question: How much are property taxes in Spain?
faqs.answer: Annual property tax (IBI) ranges 0.4-1.1% of cadastral property value – approximately €400-600 annually for this property. Additionally, non-resident property owners pay 19% wealth tax on properties exceeding €600,000 (not applicable here). Rental income becomes taxable at standard rates if the property generates holiday letting revenue.

faqs.question: What is the cost of living in Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca offers affordable Mediterranean living. Monthly costs for a couple: €1,000-1,500 housing (depending on rental choices), €400-600 groceries and dining, €200-300 utilities and transport. Healthcare and education through private systems cost €150-300 monthly. Overall monthly living expenses range €1,750-2,700 depending on lifestyle preferences.

faqs.question: Can I get a mortgage in Spain as a foreigner?
faqs.answer: Yes, multiple Spanish banks and international lenders offer mortgages to foreign buyers, typically covering 60-70% of property value with competitive rates (currently 3-4%). Non-EU citizens require Spanish income documentation or equivalent income proof. British buyers often use currency exchange specialists to optimize purchasing power.

faqs.question: What is the weather like on Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate with 300+ annual sunshine days. Summers reach 28°C with low rainfall; winters average 18°C making snow virtually unknown. Autumn and spring (20-24°C) provide ideal beach weather. The region experiences more stable weather than northern Europe, though occasional storm systems may arrive in autumn.

faqs.question: What rental income can I expect from this property?
faqs.answer: Holiday rental potential for similar 3-bedroom Gran Alacant properties averages €800 weekly during peak summer season (June-September), €500-700 shoulder months (April-May, September-October), and €400-500 off-season. Conservative annual projections suggest €20,000-25,000 gross rental income (5-6% yield), achievable through direct management or professional rental agencies.
